author: Betsy Wooters

review: I bought this item and it has been relatively seamless to use. It came preloaded with my info, which was nice. I added Netflix, Hulu, and Youtube and Pandora to the device and use them regularly.After about two months of using the Fire TV it started producing a random tinny or fishbowl sounding audio signal. I would have to reset it to get it to go away. So I switched to the optical cable and used that instead of running the sound through the HDMI to the tv. The optical cable went to my surround sound system, and the tinny sound still persisted at random times. So I tried it on my tv upstairs through the HDMI again and the same tinny sound came through randomly too.After having contacted amazon customer service, to get the processed started for a warranty replacement, they informed me that I have to contact my two manufacturers of my tvs and surround sound manufacturer to "try to get the issue resolved through them" and have to provide documentation that I have done so to get Amazon to "look into the issue further."If on 3 separate devices (55" Mitsubishi T CinemaVision 50" and a Samsung 42" LCD and a JVC Surround Sound receiver) and 2 separate sound connections (HDMI and Optical) the sound shows up as tinny randomly, it's not the devices the Fire TV is connected to. Definitely the last time I buy an Amazon product if their warranty policy is this rediculous.
